Comparison among baseline algorithms. ‚ÄúMask‚Äù means the provided mask for 3D understanding (‚Äúgt‚Äù means ground truth mask and ‚Äúpred‚Äù means Mask-RCNN mask).
‚ÄúwKP‚Äù means using keypoint predictions.
‚ÄúMP‚Äù stands for mask pooling and ‚ÄúOF‚Äù stands for offset flow.
‚ÄúTimes(s)‚Äù indicates the average inference times cost for processing each image.
c0subscriptùëê0c_{0} is the most loose criterion for evaluating AP and c5subscriptùëê5c_{5} is in the middle of criterion.
Note, the implementation of 3D-RCNN adopts the ground truth mask prediction during inference.

references:
Apolloscape Car Instance dataset:
We compare with the state-of-the-art detectors of A3DP-Abs criterion in Tab.¬†1.
The baseline method 6D-VNet¬†[47] extends Mask R-CNN by adding customised heads for predicting vehicle‚Äôs finer class, rotation and translation with non-local module as an attention mechanism.
3D-RCNN¬†[27] provides regression towards translation, allocentric rotation, and car shape parameters.
The baseline is further extended by adding mask pooling (MP) and offset flow (OF)¬†[43]. They together help voiding geometric distortion from regular RoI pooling and bring attention mechanism to focus on relevant regions.
The ‚Äúhuman‚Äù performance is obtained by the asking the human labeller to re-label the key points, and then passing them through the context-aware 3D solver.
Comparing with the direct regression approach, our approach achieves 1.4%percent1.41.4\% absolute mean AP improvement.

references:
PKU/Baidu dataset:
We compare with the public solutions for evaluating A3DP-Abs criterion in Tab.¬†2.
QNet¬†[21] is a two-stage detector that firstly detects 2D bounding boxes using Faster R-CNN¬†[40] and then a separate network for 6D-pose regression.
CenterNet¬†[51] is an anchor-free object detector that uses keypoint estimation to find center points and regresses all other object properties.
CenterNet along has trouble regressing translation vector. CoordConv¬†[31] is a solution that give convolution access to its own input coordinates through the use of extra coordinate channels.

references: Bayesian weight learning: Row 1 & 2 in Tab.¬†4 demonstrate that the coefficient learning paradigm is effective in updating the weights for multi-task losses.

Neural 6-DoF Mesh Refiner:Row 4 & 5 in Tab.¬†4 show that by including RùëÖR into optimisation process will lead to overfitting of the neural mesh refiner network. For example, the refiner will allow car flip so as to match the weakly supervised signal of silhouette. Fixing RùëÖR will direct the refiner to focus on updating translational vector.
